page.title: 09Home Life, Rules, 50 Yrs Ago
page.content: Discipline was strict in some families. Nobody was allowed to get down from the table before the others had finished eating. Talking by children at the table was not allowed unless they were asked to. Many families said grace at mealtimes. At school talking was forbidden & everyday there was an assembly. Outside discipline was also strict. Girls were not allowed to walk along the seafront in their bathing costumes. If they did a policeman would ask them to put on their coats. No-one went into a shop bare-footed. There was no grafitti to be seen anywhere.
